content.text:
<image 1>(asthma) fill in the blank for the pathophysiology pathway (D.C= dendritic cell)

A. Columnar epithelial cells detect activated Dendritic cells and secrete thymic stromal lymphocytes.
B. Activated Dendritic cell secretes a hormone.
C. Mast cell is activated through the activation of the D.C and secretes thymic stromal lymphocytes.
D. Thymic stromal lymphocytes are created by TH2 cells which have detected the activation of the dendritic cell.

The correct pathway for the given image is:

B. Activated Dendritic cell secretes a hormone.

This pathway is consistent with the process described in the image. When a pathogen is engulfeded by an O.C. cell ( (which is likely a mistake for "D.C. cell"), it activates the D.C. cell. The activated D.C. cell then secretes a hormone, which attracts Th2 cells and enables the D.C. to differentiate T-cells to Th2 cells. Th2 cells then promote IgE production, promote mast cell activity, and bind to create mast cell IgE complexes, which ultimately stimulate eosininophil production.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
